title: Geordie Shore's Chloe Ferry grapples with her assets in a skintight LBD
text:
She's no stranger to flashing the flesh in a racy Instagram post.

Yet Chloe Ferry came dangerously close to exposing too much of herself as she stumbled out of Tiger Tiger nightclub in Newcastle on Tuesday.

The Geordie Shore star, 24, grappled with her assets as she struggled to keep her balance whilst filming the series alongside her co-stars.

Chloe did well to protect her modesty on the tumble, as the star's fitted little black dress left little to imagination.

The reality starlet went braless in the backless garment, which featured delicate spaghetti straps and lace up detailing on the back.

Boosting her frame with a pair of barely-there heels, Chloe completed the look by sweeping her glossy golden locks into a high ponytail.

Chloe was seen strolling hand in hand with show newbie Amelia Lily on the outing, suggesting that they had patched things up since falling out earlier in the week.

On Sunday night, Chloe was heard shouting at Amelia, refusing to let her into the minis with the rest of the Geordie Shore gang.

A source told MailOnline: 'The cast all left the club without Amelia, who was brought out last by producers.

'She was asked to jump into the back of the minibus with Chloe, Bethan and Natalie, but Chloe kicked off and refused to open the door.'

Producers were forced to intervene to try and resolve the situation, but Chloe point blank refused to give in and wouldn't let Amelia join them in the car.

In video footage of the incident, a producer is heard asking, 'Can you check the list and tell me what car Amelia's supposed to get in?'

Moments later, Amelia emerges and tries to get into the back, but Chloe slams the door in her face.

'Go home! Go in the other car! No! No!', Chloe is heard shouting.

The producer chimes in, 'Chloe I need her in the back', prompting Chloe to kick and lash out in the backseat as someone else says, 'She's not having any of it, mate!'.

Amelia eventually had to be bundled into the front of the vehicle, looking upset as she held her head in her hands.

Thus far, Amelia had appeared to get on well with her new co-stars and had been seen filming with them all week.

Amelia has been brought into the fold in a bid to shake up the long-running series following a string of departures.

A source told The Sun: 'Bosses are made up they've signed Amelia for the show and promise she will make it the best series yet, she's always up for a laugh and will make great telly for viewers.

'Amelia's not shy about saying what she thinks either so things could get explosive.'

Chloe's ex Sam Gowland and show stalwart Sophie Kaseai have left the show ahead of the upcoming 21st series.

Cast members for this series are expected to be Chloe, Amelia, James Tindale, Nathan Henry, Abbie Holborn, Beau Brennan, Tahlia Chung, Anthony Kennedy Bethan Kershaw and Natalie Phillips.
